title: 109_s505
content: Yuma Crossing National Heritage Area boundary adjustment. The Yuma Crossing National Heritage Area boundaries are amended to include the riverfront and downtown areas, with specific details on the boundary lines. The Yuma Crossing National Heritage Area boundaries are amended to include the riverfront and downtown areas, extending along Quechan Road/Penitentiary Avenue, the north bank of the Colorado River, 23rd Avenue, and the Yuma Valley Levee/Yuma Valley Railroad right-of-way. The Yuma Valley Levee/Yuma Valley Railroad and Lovers Lane intersect with First Street, then continue along the alleyway between 1st and 2nd Avenues to Giss Parkway, and finally along Giss Parkway to 2nd Avenue. The curr_chunk describes a route starting from the intersection of 2nd Avenue and 4th Street, then moving along 4th Street to the alleyway between 3rd and 4th Avenues, continuing along the alleyway to 5th Street, and finally along 5th Street to 4th Avenue. The total distance covered is approximately 2080 ft. The route described in the curr_chunk starts at the intersection of 4th Avenue and 6th Street, then continues along 6th Street to the alleyway between 3rd and 4th Avenues, followed by a southerly direction along the alleyway to 7th Street. From there, it moves along 7th Street to 3rd Avenue, and finally along 3rd Avenue to 8th Street, covering a total distance of approximately 2080 ft. The route continues from the intersection of 8th Street and Madison Avenue, then follows Madison Avenue to 5th Street, and then along 5th Street to the Union Pacific/Southern Pacific Railroad right-of-way. It then proceeds along the railroad right-of-way to Prison Lane. The route continues from the intersection of 8th Street and Madison Avenue, following Madison Avenue to 5th Street, then along 5th Street to the Union Pacific/Southern Pacific Railroad right-of-way, and finally along the southern right-of-way line of the Gila River Levee for a total distance of 16,860 ft to the southwest section corner of Township 8 South, Range 22 West, Section 19.
